entry.title: [User Education] Simplify idle detection and session logic
entry.content:
This change removes the idea of an "idle timeout" for browser activity

when showing IPH.



Previously, if the browser window was active, but the machine itself was

idle for more than a particular period of time (~30s), IPH could not

show. This was deemed both dangerous (because we only poll for activity

every 15 seconds and the first update when Chrome starts or we resume

from a locked state we might be operating with stale data and spuriously

block an IPH. Conversely, if no update had happened, an IPH that should

be blocked by the grace period might show in some cases.



The new system does the following:

- When an update arrives where the idle time is more than 1.5 polling

intervals, it is ignored. This mostly just prevents hammering the

prefs system by writing the same stale active time over and over.

- IPH may show any time the browser window is active. We assume that

IPH are triggered by user action or important events like a bad

download or low memory - especially lightweight promos that might

time out. Also since most computers lock when idle, the browser

should lose focus in these cases.

- When an IPH wants to show and the last known active time is longer

ago than the new session idle time, we recheck the activity state

right away. This handles the "just returne from inactive" and

"browser just started" cases. The assumption is that user action will

have triggered the IPH so the machine *should* be active again; this

can then start a new session, which means the IPH might be blocked by

the grace period.



This is all accomplished by:

- Removing the "minimum time to idle" constant.

- Removing the IsApplicationActive() method that was used to gate IPH.

- Switching from IdleState struct to optional last known active time.

- IdleObserver doesn't send updates when there is no new information.

- "MaybeUpdateIdleTime()" method added for smart on-demand updates.

- MaybeUpdateIdleTime() called before showing an IPH.



Tests have been added to verify the new behavior both at the session

manager and promo controller levels, and test code has been updated to

reflect the new simplified API.



Open questions that will have to be determined through metrics:

- Is it safe to assume that toast IPH do not (regularly) show when the

machine is idle?

- Is there any case where we would force an update repeatedly, because

the machine is not actually idle?



Again, both of these seem unlikely, but we will need to watch the

metrics to ensure nothing untoward is happening. Existing histograms

*should* be sufficient to detect issues, but we could add a "IPH showed

during idle period" metric.



Bug: 324516627

Change-Id: I924b82c2abad3ce43f063002ecff03d1900093d3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5322857

Commit-Queue: Dana Fried

entry.title: Move screen_ai directory from components to services.
entry.content:
We are using the screen ai service to annotate the accessibility tree

that is provided to content public APIs. There is precedent for doing

this already from the content layer: AXImageAnnotator (in

content/renderer/accessibility/annotations) depends on

services/image_annotation to annotate images in the accessibility tree

with alt text. We're doing something similar with the screen_ai service,

to annotate the accessibility tree with a "main" role. Since screen ai

will now be depended on by content, it is now considered a foundational

service and should be located in //services rather than

//components/services.



This CL does the following:

1. Move screen_ai from //components/services to //services.

2. Rename every instance of //components/services to //services.

3. Move //components/test/data/screen_ai to

//services/test/data/screen_ai.

4. Move the include rules and deps from //components/BUILD to

//services/BUILD.

5. Move strings defined in components_strings to services_strings.

6. Add service test strings file path to ServiceTestSuite.

7. Update service_strings outputs to abide by ios naming convention.



Bug: 327248308

Change-Id: I358d9be39838cc45cd50f2d8a2b7f8d7d9b99b44

entry.title: [base] Update Erase()/EraseIf() calls for std::vector<> in components/
entry.content:
They're now replaced with C++20 std::erase()/std::erase_if().



Script:

```

* extract files referencing Erase()/EraseIf() on cs via css selectors *



1. Run sed replacements:

's/base::EraseIf/std::erase_if/g'

's/base::Erase/std::erase/g'

's/#include "b/c/cxx20_erase.h"/#include /g'

's/#include "b/c/cxx20_erase_vector.h"/#include /g'



2. Run git cl format to sieve include upwards

3. Run sed with -z to separate include from quoted includes

(above and below)



's/ #include / #include /g'

's/" #include /" #include /g'



4. Run sed with -z to force includes on the remaining files:



's/#include <(\w+)>/#include <\1> #include /g'



5. Run git cl format to collapse duplicate includes



6. Fix outliers by hand :)

```



Bug: 40256229

entry.title: [Extensions] Emit multi worker metrics.
entry.content:
New metrics:

Extensions.ServiceWorkerBackground.MultiWorkerVersionStatus.NewWorker

Extensions.ServiceWorkerBackground.MultiWorkerVersionStatus.PreviousWorker

Extensions.ServiceWorkerBackground.MultiWorkerVersionIdMatch



MultiWorkerVersionStatus records the service worker version status when

we have two workers added for the same extension.



MultiWorkerVersionIdMatch determines, from the two above workers, if

their service worker version IDs match.



Didn't add any testing because this is to gather data on a real world

scenario that we do not know how to reproduce.

entry.title: [SurfacePolish] Fix bug about toolbar flips to white when navigating
entry.content:
from NTP to webpage



When navigating from the NTP to a webpage, the toolbar color initially

changes to the default toolbar color during the loading phase. It will

change to the browser tab's color or stay unchanged after the loading

phase. The loading process occurs directly on the NTP. However, with the

Start Surface Polish enabled, the NTP's toolbar has a different color

than the default toolbar, and this results in a flip of white when

navigating from NTP to webpage, as shown in the

image:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ywogmzelW1OQwGdPCvrd0EndFkAbvCoM/

view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-XV6pRmumU3L4vy36HRSJ4w.

This CL aims to fix this problem.



When navigating from the NTP to a webpage, the ToolbarPhone#mVisualState

will immediately turn from VisualState.NEW_TAB_NORMAL or

VisualState.NEW_TAB_SEARCH_ENGINE_NO_LOGO to VisualState.NORMAL called

by function ToolbarPhone#onTabOrModelChanged. This is the starting point

of the loading phase.



The ending point of the loading phase is the time we know if we have a

website theme color. The time we start to know whether the website has

its theme color is the time point ToolbarPhone#onPrimaryColorChanged()

gets called. Since this function won't be called when the website does

not have a specific theme color, I added a function

ToolbarPhone#onPrimaryColorGotUpdateNotified() instead. The newly added

function will be called at the same time if

ToolbarPhone#onPrimaryColorChanged() gets called. And the ending point

is marked inside this function.



After this CL, the navigation process will look like

this:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FchVCPWj3DnLaMoZ1Z5Ra_7Z6SIavRSV/

view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-tT-y6F12OihXzxjeTnRaIw



Bug: 323888159

Change-Id: I0e790c2c140a118b8863194f78932168067861cd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272687

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

Commit-Queue: Xinyi Ji

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266588}

entry.title: Invalidate cache of all ancestor forms when adding Shadow DOM children.
entry.content:
When kAutofillIncludeFormElementsInShadowDom is enabled, the

shadow-tree-including listed elements of a form include all descendants

that are not explicitly assigned (via form-attribute) to a different

form. In particular, they include the descendants of nested forms

inside Shadow DOM.



This CL updates the cache invalidation mechanism for listed elements

inside shadow DOM to invalidate the cache of all ancestor forms and

not just the nearest one.

entry.content:
The GPM PIN virtual member needs the client to set some metadata: the

encrypted PIN so that other instances of Chrome can fetch it and perform

operations.



Rather than add another argument to `RegisterAuthenticationFactor`, I

folded the type and the type hint into a `variant`, as I suspect that

Chrome OS devices might be a separate type in the future too.

entry.title: Reland "Fix CHIPS for WebView when 3PCs are not enabled"
entry.content:
If an Android developer disables 3PCs in their app, paritioned cookies

will not be returned. The root cause of this is that WebView uses its

own settings for cookies from the rest of Chromium.



The behaviour of Chromium is that partitioned cookies are still returned

when 3PCs are disabled so we are matching that.



When we originally landed this change, it had performance issues because

we were not providing the shared version string that the renderer relies

on for GetCookiesString to avoid making additional IPCs. We don't have

easy access to that value because it is in shared memory which the

WebView restricted cookie manager doesn't view. This approach is

improved by actually plumbing if we should care about the 3pcs or not

down to the restricted cookie manager so that it can deal with all the

quirks that WebView code might not know about.



The one downside here is that there is an intention to keep the

restricted cookie manager on parity with the cookie manager mojom but

this seems like a reasonable balance to avoid letting lower layers know

more about WebView specific implementation details.



Bug: 1523962

Change-Id: I92541b46eb134947d8a241742a007954e87ea8fc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317989

Commit-Queue: David Schinazi

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

Reviewed-by: David Schinazi

Auto-Submit: Rupert Wiser

Reviewed-by: Christian Dullweber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266561}

entry.title: cargo vet: Consistent, minimal descriptions of audit criteria.
entry.content:
`cargo aggregate` (e.g. used [1] by the `google/rust-crate-audits` repo)

requires that criteria descriptions are identical across all the sources

(e.g. `ub-risk-2` has to have the exact same descriptions in all

`audits.toml` that are being aggregated). This CL addresses this

requirement:



* `ub-risk-N`: Criteria descriptions are copied from

https://fuchsia-review.git.corp.google.com/c/fuchsia/+/995606

* `crypto-safe` and `does-not-implement-crypto`: Criteria descriptions

are copied from

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/third_party/rust_crates/+/refs/heads/main/cargo-vet/audits.toml

* `rule-of-two-safe-to-deploy` (from ChromeOS) and `ub-risk-N-thorough`

(from google3): This CL removes these criteria from Chromium's

`audits.toml` and `config.toml` because 1) they are not currently

used/referenced in Chromium's `audits.toml` and 2) this avoids having

to worry about unification of their descriptions (at least for now).



This CL should unblock adding Chromium's `audits.toml` to the `sources.list`

in the `google/rust-crate-audits` repo.



[1] https://github.com/google/rust-crate-audits/blob/main/.github/workflows/aggregate.yml



Bug: 40255439

Change-Id: I3d9279e3826b023532ca9845f736ab5e594a3aa6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328059

Reviewed-by: danakj

entry.title: [base] Update Erase()/EraseIf() calls for std::vector<> in cc/
entry.content:
They're now replaced with C++20 std::erase()/std::erase_if().



Script:

```

* extract files referencing Erase()/EraseIf() on cs via css selectors *



1. Run sed replacements:

's/base::EraseIf/std::erase_if/g'

's/base::Erase/std::erase/g'

's/#include "b/c/cxx20_erase.h"/#include /g'

's/#include "b/c/cxx20_erase_vector.h"/#include /g'



2. Run git cl format to sieve include upwards

3. Run sed with -z to separate include from quoted includes

(above and below)



's/ #include / #include /g'

's/" #include /" #include /g'



4. Run sed with -z to force includes on the remaining files:



's/#include <(\w+)>/#include <\1> #include /g'



5. Run git cl format to collapse duplicate includes



6. Fix outliers by hand :)

```



Bug: 40256229

Change-Id: I9558dc1bd739195d08cd34d29af491aacb1d4161

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5326906

Auto-Submit: Andrew Rayskiy

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

Commit-Queue: Jonathan Ross

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266559}

entry.title: Ignore page-orientation @page descriptor when printing selection.
entry.content:
We were already ignoring any @page size, but due to the fact that some

special-code for page orientation used the source frame, rather than the

special frame that contains the text selection, it got honored.



This is a minor issue in itself, but I'm working on adding a requirement

that (WebLocalFrame's) GetPageDescription() only be called between

PrintBegin() and PrintEnd(), and this code would then cause trouble.

entry.title: webauthn: record that a Vault is a `PIN` only if it's a 6-digit number.
entry.content:
We record the form of a GPM PIN in two places: once in the WrappedPIN

proto (for clients) and once in the Vault proto (for MagicArch). We'll

describe the secret to Vault as a PIN only if it is a 6-digit value.

That way, we can use this to determine whether MagicArch should show a

GPM UI, or a regular text box for arbitrary text entry.



Change-Id: Id84df440e30ad92ed1b232b5c52b0703ca672211

entry.title: Fix non-left click handling on scrollbars.
entry.content:
When MiddleClickAutoScroll is enabled, dragging the scrollbar with the middle

mouse button, both autoscroll and scrollbar dragging are triggered

simultaneously, resulting in uncontrolled scrolling.



When clicking on the scrollbar with the mouse's kForward or kBack button,

it triggers page navigation and and results in scrolling on the destination

page.



In the mentioned scenario, the scrollbars should not handle click events.



Bug: 40795276

Change-Id: Ie6d529a8aa14c853950f8d351281c790205f0dee

entry.title: contextmenu: propagate initiator when opening in profile
entry.content:
When opening a link in another profile via the renderer context menu, we

need to pass the initiating origin through in case that link causes the

external protocol dialog to be displayed - otherwise, the external

protocol dialog won't be attributed to the origin the link came from.

entry.title: Speculative fix for dangling progress ring animation pointer.
entry.content:
NOTREACHED crashes indicate that the dangling progress ring animation

pointer in `OnRingAnimationUpdatedForKey()`'s posted task is being

destroyed before the task is run. The code needs to be updated to

indicate that this is acceptable now that raw_ptr expectations are being

enforced.

entry.title: [Tracing] Use Perfetto client library for tracing on all platforms
entry.content:
The Perfetto client library has been used for tracing on most

platforms, unblocking multiple improvements in tracing stability

and usefulness. This CL makes it the default everywhere, so that

the old tracing macros implementation can finally be removed.



The binary size increase has been thoroughly addressed (see

https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/g/chrome-binary-size/c/XoLlXvAc_5s for details), but some overhead is unavoidable.

As discussed on fuchsia-dev@, this is acceptable.



Bug: 1006541

Fuchsia-Binary-Size: see above.

entry.title: Add DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK for supports_rgb_to_yuv_conversion
entry.content:
supports_rgb_to_yuv_conversion can be false only with validating

command decoder which doesn't support any YUV<=>RGB conversion or with

Rasterdecoder on Graphite if dawn doesn't support multiplanar render

attachment on specific platforms.



Validating command decoder is used only on Android, but android should

always use RasterDecoder.



So skia code shouldn't be reachable here, but to make sure add

DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK first.

entry.title: Reland "[Reland] Use LAYER_NOT_DRAWN if frame will not be used"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 81586343e66cad6c4c60fe5b8c11c80c7250d439.



Reason for revert: Fix the window transparency when a window is created in maximized/fullscreen. In that case, shadow object has

not yet been created



Original change's description:

> Revert "[Reland] Use LAYER_NOT_DRAWN if frame will not be used"

>

> This reverts commit 9eaef3f676f9a86cd9209ff801d89d2e474c1a19.

>

> Reason for revert: causing Lacros freeze P0 b/327079084

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Reland] Use LAYER_NOT_DRAWN if frame will not be used

> >

> > This is reland of crrev.com/c/5212308.

> > The root cause of crbug.com/1522740 was fixed in (crrev.com/c/5282732).

> >

> > 1) Lacros will use custom opacity control in exo instead of

> > kWindowManagerManagesOpacityKey

> > 2) It makes window opaque in Maximized and Fullscreen but not Snapped

> > This was causing visual glitch.

> > 3) If the frame is not used, the widget's layer will be NOT_DRAWN

> > which should save memory.

> > 3.1) I made small change to the frame protocol. Frame should be set

> > before first commit in order for that subsequent frame change

> > work. This is because layer's type can't be changed on the fly.

> >

> > Bug: 1445751

> > Test: Updated existing tests to cover new behavior.

> > Change-Id: I13b5bbbbffc9b3f6821152f65c41cfecdc96d028

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280505

entry.title: webui: use preloaded contents to show top chrome WebUI
entry.content:
This patch integrates WebUIContentsPreloadManager with BrowserView and

WebUIContentsWrapper. It adds two preload modes:

- preload-on-warmup: preloads on browser window creation and after every

top chrome WebUI creation. This mode currently causes test failures

and is tracked by crbug.com/326505383.

- preload-on-make-contents: preloads only after every WebUI creation.

this is the default mode.



This patches also stops navigating the preloaded contents to a different

WebUI because it causes CHECK failures in //content. The task to enable

redirection is tracked by crbug.com/325836830.



This patch removes one histogram

- Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.NavigatedWebContents

and adds two histograms

- Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.PreloadedRenderer

- Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.ReshowingWebContents

that were both categorized under "NavigatedWebContents", but were

discovered to differ significantly.



This patch has no behavior change in both tests and production.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.NavigatedWebContents]=Replaced by Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.ReshowingWebContents



Bug: 40168622

Change-Id: Ie80da4f886d582cd4b194e6baea3c406dd1b99fa

entry.title: Add multidimensional variants to test generator for blur filter tests
entry.content:
Variants in the test generator enable the creation of different versions

of a test while using the same main test body. Until now, variants had

to be a single set of scenarios for the test, for them to be generated

one by one. This change adds a `variant_matrix` parameter that can

receive several variant sets as input, and generates tests using every

possible combination by selecting an option from each variant (like the

Cartesian product of the sets).



In this version it is not possible to use both the existing `variants`

parameter and the new `variant_matrix` parameter at the same time.



To support flexible naming structures with variants, the generator now

exposes the different variant names used as an array that can be used

as a jinja variable, and a parameter (`append_variants_to_name`) that

disables the automatic appending of variant names at the end of the

test name.



The test for the `gaussianBlur` filter now uses this `variant_matrix` to

keep its existing variants and also test all of them both with layers

and `CanvasFilter` objects.



`gentestutilsunion.py` was formatted with `git cl format` by

commenting the line that excludes web_tests/external/wpt:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:.yapfignore;l=6



Bug: 1396372

entry.title: [A11y] Fix bug at high magnifications where centered mode could not move left/down
entry.content:
When in centered mode, the magnifier could not move left or down at high zoom levels because we truncated floating-point DIP cursor position to the floor int, so movements less than a full DIP didn't have an impact.

This change rounds instead of truncating, which makes the magnifier

behave better at very high zoom levels, and still feel reactive.



Tests are different for this because EventGenerator works in integer

DIPs rather than floating-point DIPs or pixels. In real life, the

mouse position is tracked in floating-point DIPs, so incremental

movements will add up.



See http://b/326468396#comment9 for videos of the existing behavior,

the behavior with the bug fix, and also how centered magnifier looks on

mac.



Bug: b:326468396

AX-Relnotes: Fixes magnifier bug at high zoom

Test: New, manual with all magnifier modes to ensure edges reachable & behave correctly, and dragging still works across monitors

entry.title: [Default Nav Transitions] Clamp springs models to prevent overshooting
entry.content:
b/326850774 was introduced in 3-button mode, by a left-fling in the

"gesture invoke" zone of the screen. Such a fling can carry so much

momentum, that when the physics model switches to the commit-pending

spring, the commit-pending spring overshoots over the left edge,

causing CHECK failure in the animator.



For now, clamp the motions of all three springs to restrict them inside

the viewport. For a proper solution, we should port the gesture logic

from the gesture nav mode into 3-button mode (crbug.com/327386236)

entry.title: [UPM] Split PasswordStoreBackendMigrationDecorator
entry.content:
Before: PasswordStoreBackendMigrationDecorator was responsible for all

possible migration types. Whenever some migration was required it called

BuiltInBackendToAndroidBackendMigrator::StartMigrationIfNecessary.



After: PasswordStoreBackendMigrationDecorator is responsible for

migrating of local passwords only. It calls BuiltInBackendToAndroidBackendMigrator::StartMigrationOfLocalPasswords.

LegacyPasswordStoreBackendMigrationDecorator performs all remain

migrations. It's created only when UseUpmLocalAndSeparateStoresState

is kOff. BuiltInBackendToAndroidBackendMigrator::StartMigrationIfNecessary now

won't start local password migration under any circumstances.



Fixed: b/323880741

entry.title: Start Isolate in foreground mode for mimehandler processes
entry.content:
In Edge, we've seen a regression in the time to load a PDF document when

the feature V8EfficiencyModeTiering is enabled. I'm not sure how much

code is shared between Chrome and Edge regarding PDF rendering, but I

believe at least the overall architecture matches: there is an extension

renderer process (the "mimehandler") which needs to run some script.

This renderer process is initializing its V8 Isolate in background mode,

which causes a slower overall load. As described at [1], extension

processes start their Isolates in background mode because they might not

have any way to detect visibility. However, the PDF mimehandler process

does in fact get notified when its visibility changes, so it can safely

start up in foreground mode.



In this CL, I propose adding another command-line switch so that the

browser process can indicate that the renderer should start its Isolate

in foreground mode.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_initializer.cc;drc=7477a270035df963ba48d3f7ea4d8b384bce770c;l=951



Change-Id: Ibedb3fd8e80168e515394804805a5b7fcf44ba49

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5304236

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: Seth Brenith

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

entry.title: [//media] Have GMBVideoFramePool get texture target from ClientSI
entry.content:
As part of eliminating gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget() in favor of clients

calling ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(), this CL changes

GpuMemoryBufferVideoFramePool from calling

GpuVideoAcceleratorFactories::ImageTextureTarget() to instead get the

texture target directly from the SharedImage that it creates.



The one production implementation of ImageTextureTarget() [1] that is

used in this context calls through to gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget(),

passing the client-specified buffer format and a hardcoded buffer

usage. Hence, we pass the same buffer format and buffer usage here

(ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferUsage, BufferFormat) is a

drop-in replacement for gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget()). We will

eliminate ImageTextureTarget() once we have converted all callers.



NOTE: BrowserGpuVideoDecodeAcceleratorFactories is also a production

subclass of GpuVideoAcceleratorFactories, but it is not and *cannot* be

used here as it does not provide a SharedImageInterface [2], which is

required to reach the code here [3].



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/renderer/media/gpu/gpu_video_accelerator_factories_impl.cc;l=290;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/media/android/browser_gpu_video_accelerator_factories.cc;l=170-173;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/gpu_memory_buffer_video_frame_pool.cc;l=1245-1249;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;bpv=1;bpt=1



Bug: 41494843

entry.title: p13n: uint32_t to id SeaPen images
entry.content:
SeaPen images do not need to be referenced by a full filepath.

Instead, always refer to them by the uint32_t generation_seed field from

the manta API. This increases the security of SeaPen related APIs by

preventing users from possibly being able to pass in arbitrary FilePath

arguments, and reduces the risk of developer mistakes.



Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*SeaPen*

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=*SeaPenProvider*

Change-Id: Iae12e3972a81105ac4ce0f1c8a63cd85ee3f28e6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5281495

Reviewed-by: Jason Thai

Reviewed-by: Charles Zhao

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

Commit-Queue: Jeffrey Young

entry.title: [ios] Fix UI string for bookmark key command when account bookmark exists
entry.content:
Before this patch, isBookmarkedPage() only considered local-or-syncable

bookmarks, ignoring whether or not an account bookmark exists. This

affects the string in the UI for keyboard shortcuts, which should

display "Edit" instead of "Add".



The actual behavior of the shortcut, even before this patch, is

implemented via BookmarksCoordinator's createOrEditBookmarkWithURL,

which does integrate with all existing bookmarks and will therefore edit

the bookmark if an account bookmark exist with the same URL,

contradicting the string in the UI.



Change-Id: Iabd1491800ae09bb47efd481fa7fbe47afda3379

Bug: 326185948

Fixed: 327358882
